title: Camila Cabello dances to a High School Musical song in white robe
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Camila Cabello has proved to us all that she is just like us when it comes to singing and dancing to our favourite hits, after she posted a video of her dancing along to a High School Musical classic in a white robe.

The singer took to Instagram to post a video of her performing along to the High School Musical 2 song Fabulous, originally performed by Sharpay Evans (Ashley Tisdale) in the second instalment of the film franchise.

And she really went for it.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Camila could be seen in her bathroom dressed in the robe, as she twirled around and busted her best moves for the camera, lip synced into a water bottle like it was a microphone and even mimicked actions to go along with the song.

She’s clearly a High School Musical fan at heart, and we are here for it.

‘Welcome to adulthood everybody,’ she captioned the post.

‘This is the only adulthood I’m interested in,’ one fan said in the comments.

‘A whole mood when school’s over,’ another added.

Camila gave it all her (Picture: Instagram)

‘You are my spirit animal,’ another commented.

And although she takes pride in showing off her performing skills to fans on social media, the former Fifth Harmony star recently revealed that although she uses Instagram in order to stay connected with her fanbase, admitting ‘it takes you away from real life’, while she tends to stay off Twitter.

‘I don’t go on Twitter at all. Twitter is f*****g terrible,’ she told The Sun.

She later pretended that her water bottle was a microphone (Picture: Instagram)

‘I’m mostly on Instagram because I want to interact with my fans. But I just felt an hour ago, “Eurgh, I wanna delete this app.”

‘You get sucked back into it again and it takes you away from real life. That’s the least of the worst scenarios.’

The 22-year-old also admitted to ‘tearing up’ to Jesy Nelson’s Odd One Out documentary about bullying and online trolls.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I teared up – that made such a big impression on me,’ she said.

‘Not to that point but I definitely felt the depths of struggling, and when I heard that, I just really felt what she was saying.

‘I felt her pain, and for somebody to rise out of that place takes so much strength.’

description: Camila Cabello showed us all what she was made of as she shared a video of her dancing to a High School Musical classic in a white robe.
